Posts.Content: May 13, 2010 08:53PM - edited May 13, 2010 08:57PM by Hope4future Hi, I just found this website and group and very thankful.  I had a double mastectomy April 27th with reconstruction.  (Sorry I don't know abbreviations yet) I had my first check up with the surgeon yesterday and he removed my drain tubes. Not painful just a gross feeling.  I am wondering if anyone feels like when the skin on your neck is tight?  I see the oncologist the last week of May for my full path report and the nurse said he would tell me then if I will need chemo or radiation.  I have not had any yet.  So I am so new at this I don't even know if I put the right diagnosis on my profile.  I just know I had a spot on one breast but because of family history, brca and I had thyroid cancer with lymph nodes involved that I needed to have a double.   They did take 2 lymph nodes and they were clear.  I will have my first fill next Wednesday.  I will be 43 this Sunday and have 4 adopted children.  They are 11, 8, 3, and 2.  My 8 year old said Mom that Dr. must be good they are already growing back :) Thank you in advance for all the support!
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: May 13, 2010 09:34PM Hope4future wrote: I don't have much pain.  Just muscle spasm.  He put fill in during sugery.  So I am half way done with fills.  I hope that slows down soon for you.  I just know that I had one plug and I was in so much pain because of not being able to drain that I was really scared of getting them out to soon. Does it hurt to get a fill???
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: May 20, 2010 12:22AM Hope4future wrote: I had my first fill today and forgot to ask how much he filled.  I am going to call tomorrow so I know for future use.  The side he dug for lymph nodes on is very sore.  I don't want to breath to deep or it goes into spasm.  I broke down and took a vicodine....I hate that medicin...it really makes me crabby for some reason.  Has anyone had one side more sore after a fill?  He also wants me to just tell him when I am the size I want to be.  I said I want to be a normal C.  So do I just try on old bras....how am I going to know???  I am such a newbie to all of this that I feel like all I do all day is search this forum for info.....I am so thankful for this forum and all of you!
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: May 24, 2010 08:29PM Hope4future wrote: jenweg - thank you for the post.  I feel stronger after reading it. Knowing that it is ok to feel how I'm feeling and other's feel the same.  You do make me smile!  BC does suck!  First time I have said that.  Thanks again!
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: May 20, 2010 07:23PM Hope4future wrote: Jenweg- you made me giggle.  Thank you.  I did call to find out what I have for fills so far.  They put some in during surgery.  She told me 300 in one breast and 270 in the other.  I wonder why the difference.  I will ask him next week.  I am having fills weekly.  I did have surgery many times on the breast that was positive.  I have all the milk ducts removed and 3 biopsy's.  So it had become much smaller then the other breast.

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 09:23AM Hope4future wrote: Had pet scan yesterday because of pain in my rib.  I had uptake in T10 of my spine.  Now getting an MRI on Monday.  Will it ever end???? I still feel I don't have full energy back since double masc. and recon.  Does anyone else feel this way?
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: May 30, 2010 11:48PM Hope4future wrote: Thank you CandyB - it helps to hear that.  Before this surgery I could go on 5 hours a night of sleep and it never bothered me.  My mother and yours could talk : )  This is the first day I did not take a nap....and also didn't feel I needed one......I am feeling hopeful.  Maybe we are just making up for all the years we didn't!,  Thanks again!

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2010 07:11PM Hope4future wrote: Has anyone found a lump since bmx?  Last night I found one 2 inches in from my armpit and about 1 1/2 inches up from my te.  Never had a lump ther before.  Not on my cancerous side.  Is about marble size.  Easy to find hubby found it right away.  I am going to call the oncologist in the a.m. .....just wondering if anyone else had experienced anything like this???

Posts.Content: May 24, 2010 02:04PM Hope4future wrote: Have my first appt. with the Onc. since my bmx.  I find out complete report and also if I will need chemo, radiaton etc.  I have not had any prior.  It all went fast...was diagnosed and surgery 5 days later.  I know my PS said he feels he got it all.  My nodes were clear.  I am scared today.  I wish I wasn't....it makes me feel weak.

Posts.Content: May 31, 2010 03:33PM Hope4future wrote: Bio-Oil is really working on my scars and helping with the pain of fills.  M-Star told me about it.  I am 4 weeks out and my scars look terrific.  I really think this is a true mircle in the looks of my scars and the pain of the fills.
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 07:06PM Hope4future wrote: Update on lump - Onc is putting me on antibiotics - it is a lymph node - he is concerned it is mrsa.  Or cancer.  I go back on Friday to see what the antibiotics have done to it.  I also saw the PS and he said he will be removing it during the exchange surgery. Of couse not until we find out what it is.  They don't what to aspirate yet until they see what the antibiotics do on Friday.  I have been posotive until today...I want to cry so badly right now!
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2010 12:03AM Hope4future wrote: Update on my new lump - I was put on Zyvox antibiotic for a week - the Onc. was sure it was mrsa.  Wow was I sick from the the Zyvox - let's just say the bathroom was my best friend.  I was so weak I was crawling to it and had major thoughts of giving up and that is not like me.  I am a positive fighter.  So I go for the recheck and the lump is larger and firmer and not smaller....so the Zyvox was only for diet purposes I guess :) So today the Onc. made the PS surgically remove it. They wanted to admit me into the hospital for same day etc. So I stood up for myself and talked everyone in the office to give me some pills to make me sleepy and a local.  (They usually need to run 3 IV sites for any surgery because my veins don't thread/blow etc. and I throw up from anesthesia for days).  Are you all ready for the news it was FAT!!!  ok they are sending it to the lab but the PS truly feels it is fat and it was definitely not a lymph node as everyone thought.  So the nurse says during the surgery this is the only spot of fat on this girls body....the PS says I know.....and I wanted to say....that is because my Onc. made me take Zyvox last week,,,he he he So am I happy yes - but I know I can say this here and u will all understand without judging me.  I am also frustrated that the worry, pain, medical bills, etc. seem to never stop.  When estepp I believe said I have had enough I am standing right next to you sister!  I have to give my PS and his team praises.  From the start he said during the exchange which will be at the end of July I will take it out.  I am not worried about it at all.  He said I will do what you want and what your other docs want tho.  So the rollar coaster ride began and I ended up at the beginning.  But it was nice to be awake and see the look on the PS and nurses face when they realized it was fat and nothing serious.  They do feel they do care and they were as excited as I was to find out it was FAT! I have been thinking of you all and praying for you all......just wanted to give an update.  With love Kyleen
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2010 07:55PM Hope4future wrote: I had my last fill and now waiting my 1 1/2 month until I meet with the PS to see if I am streched enough to schedule my Exchange!!!  I am soooo ready to get rid of my heavy rocks! (TE) sometimes I call them my bricks.....I really find them uncomfortable.  I want to sleep on my side again...that sounds like a dream right now.  Jenweg thank you for keeping this thread going and all the support you give!
